title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0001
text: What is the main purpose of a circuit breaker in microservices?

options.text: To prevent cascading failures between services

explanation: A circuit breaker prevents cascading failures by stopping requests to a failing service until it recovers.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes the 'open' state of a circuit breaker?

options.text: Requests are blocked and fail immediately
Requests are allowed to pass through
Requests are redirected to another service

explanation: In the open state, the circuit breaker blocks requests to prevent further load on a failing service.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0003
text: What happens when a circuit breaker transitions to the 'half-open' state?

options.text: A limited number of test requests are allowed through
Requests are redirected to a fallback service

explanation: In the half-open state, a few test requests are allowed to check if the service has recovered.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0004
text: What triggers a circuit breaker to move from 'closed' to 'open'?

options.text: A threshold of consecutive failures is reached

explanation: When the number of consecutive failures exceeds a threshold, the circuit breaker opens to prevent further failures.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0005
text: Which of the following best describes the 'closed' state of a circuit breaker?

options.text: Requests are redirected to a fallback

explanation: In the closed state, all requests are allowed through because the service is considered healthy.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of using a circuit breaker?

options.text: Improves system resilience by isolating failures

explanation: Circuit breakers improve resilience by isolating failing services and preventing cascading failures.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a common library implementing the circuit breaker pattern?
explanation: Netflix Hystrix is a well-known library that implements the circuit breaker pattern for microservices.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0008
text: What is the main purpose of the 'timeout' setting in a circuit breaker?

options.text: To define how long to wait for a response before marking a failure
To define how long the circuit stays open
To define the number of allowed requests

explanation: The timeout setting defines how long the circuit breaker waits for a response before considering it a failure.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0009
text: What happens when a circuit breaker remains open for too long?

options.text: Requests continue to fail fast until the reset timeout expires
Requests are redirected to another service

explanation: When open, the circuit breaker fails requests immediately until the reset timeout allows testing again.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a key metric monitored by a circuit breaker?
explanation: Circuit breakers monitor failure rates to decide when to open or close the circuit.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0011
text: What is the purpose of the 'reset timeout' in a circuit breaker?

options.text: To determine when to transition from open to half-open
To define the maximum number of retries
To define the number of allowed failures

explanation: The reset timeout defines how long the circuit remains open before transitioning to half-open for testing.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a benefit of using a circuit breaker for user experience?

options.text: Provides faster failure responses instead of long timeouts

explanation: Circuit breakers improve user experience by failing fast instead of waiting for long timeouts.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a common fallback strategy used with circuit breakers?
explanation: Fallback strategies often return cached or default data when the circuit is open.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of using a circuit breaker?
explanation: Circuit breakers add complexity because they require additional logic for state management and monitoring.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a key difference between a retry mechanism and a circuit breaker?

options.text: Circuit breaker stops retries after repeated failures

explanation: A circuit breaker stops retries after repeated failures to prevent overloading a failing service.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a common state transition in a circuit breaker?
explanation: The typical state transition is Closed → Open → Half-Open → Closed as the service recovers.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for system stability?

options.text: Prevents resource exhaustion by failing fast

explanation: Circuit breakers prevent resource exhaustion by failing fast when a service is unavailable.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0018
text: Which of the following is a common metric used to open a circuit breaker?
explanation: Circuit breakers often open when the failure percentage exceeds a defined threshold.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0019
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for fault isolation?

options.text: Isolates failing services to prevent cascading failures

explanation: Circuit breakers isolate failing services to prevent cascading failures across the system.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0020
text: Which of the following best describes the outcome of using a circuit breaker?
explanation: Circuit breakers improve resilience and fault tolerance by preventing cascading failures and isolating faults.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0021
text: Which of the following is a common fallback mechanism used with circuit breakers?

options.text: Return cached data or default response

explanation: Fallback mechanisms like cached or default responses maintain user experience when a service fails.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0022
text: What is the main benefit of the half-open state in a circuit breaker?

options.text: To test if the failing service has recovered

explanation: The half-open state allows limited requests to test if the service is healthy again.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0023
text: Which of the following is a common configuration parameter for circuit breakers?
explanation: The failure threshold defines how many failures trigger the circuit to open.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0024
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of circuit breakers in distributed systems?
explanation: Circuit breakers prevent cascading failures by isolating failing services.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0025
text: Which of the following is a common library for implementing circuit breakers in Java?
explanation: Resilience4j is a lightweight Java library for implementing circuit breakers and other resilience patterns.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0026
text: What happens when a circuit breaker transitions from half-open to closed?

options.text: The service is considered healthy again

explanation: If test requests succeed in half-open state, the circuit closes and normal traffic resumes.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0027
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of circuit breakers?
explanation: Improper threshold tuning can cause premature or delayed circuit opening.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0028
text: Which of the following is a common metric used to close a circuit breaker?
explanation: Circuit breakers close when the success rate exceeds a defined threshold.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0029
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for user experience?

options.text: Provides immediate feedback on service unavailability

explanation: Circuit breakers fail fast, providing immediate feedback instead of long timeouts.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0030
text: Which of the following is a common use case for circuit breakers?
explanation: Circuit breakers protect dependent services from overload by stopping requests during failures.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0031
text: Which of the following is a key difference between a circuit breaker and a bulkhead pattern?

options.text: Circuit breaker isolates failing calls; bulkhead isolates resources
Circuit breaker manages threads; bulkhead manages retries
Circuit breaker caches data; bulkhead stores logs
Circuit breaker handles load balancing; bulkhead handles routing

explanation: Circuit breakers isolate failing calls, while bulkheads isolate resources to prevent total failure.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0032
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for scalability?
explanation: Circuit breakers prevent overloading downstream services by cutting off failing requests.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0033
text: Which of the following is a common fallback approach when a circuit is open?

options.text: Return a default response or cached data

explanation: Fallbacks like cached or default responses maintain service continuity when the circuit is open.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0034
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for fault isolation?

options.text: Isolates failing services to prevent cascading failures

explanation: Circuit breakers isolate failing services to prevent cascading failures across the system.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0035
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for resilience?

options.text: Allows systems to recover gracefully from failures

explanation: Circuit breakers allow systems to recover gracefully by controlling failure propagation.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0036

explanation: Circuit breakers open when the failure rate exceeds a defined threshold.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0037

options.text: Provides metrics on service health and failure rates

explanation: Circuit breakers provide metrics that help monitor service health and failure rates.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0038

explanation: Circuit breakers reduce latency by failing fast instead of waiting for timeouts.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0039
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for system stability?

options.text: Prevents resource exhaustion by cutting off failing requests

explanation: Circuit breakers prevent resource exhaustion by cutting off failing requests early.

title: MicroservicesReliabilityCircuitBreaker - Q0040
text: Which of the following is a benefit of circuit breakers for fault recovery?

options.text: Allows gradual recovery through half-open state

explanation: The half-open state allows gradual recovery by testing limited requests.

options.text: Ensures system continues to function despite partial failures

explanation: Circuit breakers ensure system reliability by isolating failures and allowing partial functionality.

options.text: Provides clear visibility into service health
